trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Sprinklr | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Sprinklr | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Sprinklr with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Sprinklr with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Sprinklr.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Sprinklr.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Sprinklr tenant
trans-unit.target: A Sprinklr tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Sprinklr will be able to single sign into the application at your Sprinklr company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Sprinklr will be able to single sign into the application at your Sprinklr company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Sprinklr
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Sprinklr

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Sprinklr.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Sprinklr.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Sprinklr.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Sprinklr.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Sprinklr, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Sprinklr, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sprinklr</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sprinklr</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Sprinklr with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Sprinklr with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Sprinklr application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Sprinklr application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Sprinklr page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Sprinklr page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sprinklr Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.sprinklr.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Sprinklr Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.sprinklr.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Sprinklr company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Sprinklr company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Administration \> Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Administration \> Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Partner \> Single Sign on from the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Partner \> Single Sign on from the left pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Partner</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Partner</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click +Add Single Sign Ons.
trans-unit.target: Click +Add Single Sign Ons.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-Ons</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-Ons</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign on page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign on page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-Ons</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-Ons</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration (e.g.: WAADSSOTest).
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration (e.g.: WAADSSOTest).

trans-unit.source: Select Enabled.
trans-unit.target: Select Enabled.

trans-unit.source: Select Use new SSO Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Select Use new SSO Certificate.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity Provider Certificate textbox,
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Identity Provider Certificate textbox,

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Entity Id textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Entity Id textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Sprinklr dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As SAML User ID Type, select Assertion contains User”s sprinklr.com username.
trans-unit.target: As SAML User ID Type, select Assertion contains User”s sprinklr.com username.

trans-unit.source: As SAML User ID Location, select User ID is in the Name Identifier element of the Subject statement.
trans-unit.target: As SAML User ID Location, select User ID is in the Name Identifier element of the Subject statement.

trans-unit.source: Close Save.
trans-unit.target: Close Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned for access inside the Sprinklr application.
trans-unit.target: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned for access inside the Sprinklr application.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts inside Sprinklr.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts inside Sprinklr.

trans-unit.source: Log into your Sprinklr company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log into your Sprinklr company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Administration \> Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Administration \> Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Client \> Users from the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Client \> Users from the left pane.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Edit user dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Edit user dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit user</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit user</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email, First Name and Last Name textboxes, type the information of an Azure AD user account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email, First Name and Last Name textboxes, type the information of an Azure AD user account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Select Password Disabled.
trans-unit.target: Select Password Disabled.

trans-unit.source: Select a Language.
trans-unit.target: Select a Language.

trans-unit.source: Select a User Type.
trans-unit.target: Select a User Type.

trans-unit.source: Click Update.
trans-unit.target: Click Update.

trans-unit.source: Password Disabled must be selected to enable a user to log in via an Identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Password Disabled must be selected to enable a user to log in via an Identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Go to Role, and then perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Go to Role, and then perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Partner Roles</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Partner Roles</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Global list, select ALL\_Permissions.
trans-unit.target: From the Global list, select ALL\_Permissions.

trans-unit.source: Click Update.
trans-unit.target: Click Update.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Sprinklr user account creation tools or APIs provided by Sprinklr to provision Azure AD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Sprinklr user account creation tools or APIs provided by Sprinklr to provision Azure AD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Sprinklr **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Sprinklr **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
